org.apache.james.mailbox.lucene.search

Class LuceneMessageSearchIndex<Id>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.james.mailbox.store.search.ListeningMessageSearchIndex<Id>
      • org.apache.james.mailbox.lucene.search.LuceneMessageSearchIndex<Id>
  • Type Parameters:
    Id -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    MailboxListener, MessageSearchIndex<Id>

    public class LuceneMessageSearchIndex<Id>
extends ListeningMessageSearchIndex<Id>
    Lucene based ListeningMessageSearchIndex which offers message searching via a Lucene index

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.james.mailbox.MailboxListener

      • setEnableSuffixMatch

        public void setEnableSuffixMatch(boolean suffixMatch)
        If set to true this implementation will use WildcardQuery to match suffix and prefix. This is what RFC3501 expects but is often not what the user does. It also slow things a lot if you have complex queries which use many "TEXT" arguments. If you want the implementation to behave strict like RFC3501 says, you should set this to true. The default is false for performance reasons
        Parameters:
        suffixMatch -
